required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: PK Study of Liquid Formulation of BIO89-100 in Subjects With NASH With Compensation Cirrhosis
clinical_study.official_title: An Open-Label, Single-Dose Pharmacokinetic Study of Liquid Subcutaneous Formulation of BIO89-100 in Subjects With Nonalcoholic Steatohepatitis (NASH) With Compensated Cirrhosis

brief_summary.textblock: This is an open-label, single-dose study to evaluate the PK profile of the liquid SC formulation of BIO89-100 in approximately 8 male and female subjects with NASH with compensated cirrhosis.

study_design_info.intervention_model_description: Open label, single dose, PK study

primary_outcome.measure: PK Profile of liquid formulation of BIO89-100
primary_outcome.description: Determine maximum observed serum drug concentration (Cmax)

primary_outcome.measure: PK Profile of liquid formulation of BIO89-100
primary_outcome.description: Area under the serum drug concentration-by-time curve from time 0 to the time of the last quantifiable drug concentration (AUC0-t)

secondary_outcome.measure: Evaluate the safety and tolerability of the BIO89-100 liquid formulation
secondary_outcome.description: Frequency and severity of adverse events (AEs) and serious adverse events (SAEs) Number of subjects who discontinued due to AEs and due to related AEs

arm_group.arm_group_label: BIO89-100 30 mg, Open Lable, Single Dose

intervention.arm_group_label: BIO89-100 30 mg, Open Lable, Single Dose

criteria.textblock:
Key Inclusion Criteria:
- Age 21 to 65
- Diagnosis of NASH with compensated cirrhosis by a hepatologist based on Liver Forum criteria.
- Model for End-Stage Liver Disease (MELD) score < 12.
- Child-Turcotte-Pugh (CTP) score < 7 (Class A).
- Fibrosis stage F4 by FibroScan.
Key Exclusion Criteria:
- History of hepatic cirrhosis decompensation, OR overt hepatic encephalopathy OR signs of hepatic cirrhosis decompensation.
- Prior transjugular intrahepatic portosystemic (TIPS) shunt procedure.
- known condition other than cirrhosis that may possibly interfere with drug absorption, distribution, metabolism, or excretion.
- Significant alcohol consumption for a period of more than 3 consecutive months within 1 year prior to screening.
